poem:
Title: "Shifting Loves – A Study in Ephron"

Ephron's wisdom, so rooted 
in the primal,
winds down in a delicate cascade:
Marriage - the desire,
singlehood - a wild reclamation.
Patterns contained in the female heart,
coursing more extremely
then, now, always.
Within such ephemeral constancy,
love – a falling leaf,
a fading flower,
in perpetual motion,
in search of the light.
Such are the seasons
of love.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
